Author: Goladus
Content: Some days, Tech Crunch seems more like a gossip tabloid than a serious news source.  I once heard someone describe TV news as an ounce of fact poured into a sea of speculation, and this isn't the first TC article I've read that's gotten really creative with the speculation part.

Author: hello_moto
Content: For a side note: Google products start to look boring. No new features. No wonder they're losing their employees; nothing more to do.

Title: A conversation with Amazon.com CEO Jeff Bezos - Charlie Rose

Author: drm237
Title: Startup with Intel ties to launch Office Live competitor

Author: tlrobinson
Content:
Summary:

J2EE sucks. Rails, Django, WebGears, and Zope are pretty nice.

The problem with this demo is that both examples (hello world, and a time tracking app) are very simple examples. While it's very easy to do simple things in Rails (can't speak for the others), it's still hard to do moderately to very complex things. There's no magic bullet.

That said, Rails, etc to make things more fun and take some of the grunt work out.
